schema_version.title: Schema Version
schema_version.description: The version of the JSON schema that the server uses to validate the object.
schema_version.comment: Do not submit. The version used to validate the object is set by the server. The default should be set to the current version.

uuid.title: UUID
uuid.description: The unique identifier associated with every object.
uuid.comment: Do not submit. The uuid is set by the server.

notes.title: Notes
notes.comment: Do not submit. A place for the DACC to keep information that does not have a place in the schema.

aliases.title: Aliases
aliases.description: Lab specific identifiers to reference an object.
aliases.comment: The purpose of this field is to provide a link into the lab LIMS and to facilitate shared objects.

items.title: Lab Alias
items.description: A lab specific identifier to reference an object.
items.comment: Current convention is colon separated lab name and lab identifier. (e.g. john-doe:42).

creation_timestamp.title: Creation Timestamp
creation_timestamp.description: The date the object was created.
creation_timestamp.comment: Do not submit. The date the object is created is assigned by the server.

submitted_by.title: Submitted By
submitted_by.description: The user who submitted the object.
submitted_by.comment: Do not submit. The user that created the object is assigned by the server.

submitter_comment.title: Submitter Comment
submitter_comment.description: Additional information specified by the submitter to be displayed as a comment on the portal.

description.title: Description
description.description: A plain text description of the object.

accession.title: Accession
accession.description: A unique identifier to be used to reference the object prefixed with IGVF.
accession.comment: Do not submit. The accession is assigned by the server.

alternate_accessions.title: Alternate Accessions
alternate_accessions.description: Accessions previously assigned to objects that have been merged with this object.
alternate_accessions.comment: Do not submit. Only admins are allowed to set or update this value.

items.title: Alternate Accession
items.description: An accession previously assigned to an object that has been merged with this object.
items.comment: Only accessions of objects that have status equal replaced will work here.

collections.title: Collections
collections.description: Some samples are part of particular data collections.
collections.comment: Do not submit. Collections are for DACC use only.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the metadata object.
status.comment: Do not submit.  This is set by admins along the process of metadata submission.

revoke_detail.title: Revoke Detail
revoke_detail.description: Explanation of why an object was transitioned to the revoked status.
revoke_detail.comment: Do not submit. This is set by admins when an object is revoked.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the metadata object.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the metadata object.

controlled_access.title: Controlled Access
controlled_access.description: Boolean value, indicating the file being controlled access, if true.

anvil_url.title: AnVIL URL
anvil_url.description: URL linking to the controlled access file that has been deposited at AnVIL workspace.

lab.title: Lab
lab.comment: Required. See lab.json for list of available identifiers.

award.title: Award
award.comment: Required. See award.json for list of available identifiers.

href.title: Hypertext REFerence
href.comment: Internal webapp URL for document file

url.title: URL
url.description: An external resource with additional information.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Documents that provide additional information (not data file).

items.title: Document
items.description: A document that provides additional information (not data file).

preferred_assay_titles.title: Preferred Assay Titles
preferred_assay_titles.description: The custom lab preferred label for the experiment performed.

enum_descriptions.RNA-seq: RNA sequencing (RNA-seq) is used to analyze the transcriptome by sequencing RNA.
enum_descriptions.scRNA-seq: Single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) profiles gene expression by sequencing RNA from individual cells.
enum_descriptions.snRNA-seq: Single-nucleus RNA sequencing (snRNA-seq) profiles gene expression by sequencing RNA from isolated nuclei.
enum_descriptions.scNT-seq: Single-cell metabolically labeled new RNA tagging sequencing (scNT-seq) enables parallel analysis of newly transcribed and pre-existing mRNAs in single cells.
enum_descriptions.scNT-seq2: An improved version of scNT-seq that employs optimized second-strand synthesis to enhance mapping rate and library complexity.
enum_descriptions.scNT-seq3: An improved version of scNT-seq that employs in situ chemical conversion to enhance throughput and scalability using the 10x Genomics droplet microfluidics platform.
enum_descriptions.scMultiome-NT-seq: Single-cell multiomic sequencing of chromatin state and metabolically labeled new RNA (scMultiome-NT-seq) enables joint analysis of chromatin accessibility, newly transcribed and pre-existing mRNAs in single cells.
enum_descriptions.Parse SPLiT-seq: Parse Split Pool Ligation-based Transcriptome sequencing (Parse SPLiT-seq) is a single-cell RNA-seq method that uses combinatorial barcoding to label the cellular origin of RNA.
enum_descriptions.ATAC-seq: Assay for Transposase-Accessible Chromatin using sequencing (ATAC-seq) measures chromatin accessibility by identifying open chromatin regions.
enum_descriptions.varACCESS: A high-throughput assay that integrates genome variants into chromatin accessibility analysis.
enum_descriptions.ACCESS-ATAC: Accessible Chromatin by Cytosine Editing Site Sequencing with ATAC-seq (ACCESS-ATAC) is used to map chromatin accessibility and transcription factor binding at high resolution by integrating cytosine deamination with ATAC-seq.
enum_descriptions.scATAC-seq: Single-cell ATAC-seq (scATAC-seq) profiles chromatin accessibility at single-cell resolution.
enum_descriptions.scACCESS-ATAC: Single-cell Accessible Chromatin by Cytosine Editing Site Sequencing with ATAC-seq (scACCESS-ATAC) is used to profile chromatin accessibility and transcription factor binding at high resolution in single cells.
enum_descriptions.snATAC-seq: Single-nucleus ATAC-seq (snATAC-seq) profiles chromatin accessibility in individual nuclei.
enum_descriptions.mtscMultiome: mitochondrial single-cell Multiome (mtscMultiome) combines 10x multiome with single-cell mitochondrial sequencing (scMito-seq) to profile mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA), chromatin accessibility, variants and transcriptional activity in individual cells.
enum_descriptions.DOGMA-seq: An adaptation of CITE-seq (Cellular Indexing of Transcriptomes and Epitopes by sequencing) for measuring gene activity across the central dogma of gene regulation.
enum_descriptions.10x multiome: A single-cell assay for simultaneously profiling gene expression (scRNA-seq) and chromatin accessibility (scATAC-seq) from the same sample.
enum_descriptions.10x multiome with MULTI-seq: Combines 10x Multiome with MULTI-seq, enabling simultaneous profiling of gene expression, chromatin accessibility, and sample multiplexing.
enum_descriptions.10x with Scale pre-indexing: 10X with Scale pre-indexing is a single-cell ATAC-seq or single-cell RNA-seq method that uses combinatorial barcoding (Tn5-based pre-indexing followed by 10X cell indexing) to label the cellular origin of open chromatin regions. The combinatorial barcoding allows "superloading" of 10X lanes increasing the throughput to hundreds of thousand cells per reaction.
enum_descriptions.MULTI-seq: Multiplexing using lipid-tagged indices for single-cell and single-nucleus RNA sequencing (MULTI-seq) is a multiplexing technique used in single-cell RNA sequencing that involves tagging individual samples with barcodes.
enum_descriptions.SHARE-seq: Simultaneous high-throughput ATAC and RNA expression with sequencing (SHARE-seq) is used for the measurement of chromatin accessibility and gene expression in the same single cell.
enum_descriptions.Histone ChIP-seq: Chromatin immunoprecipitation sequencing (ChIP-seq) maps histone modifications to study their genome-wide distribution.
enum_descriptions.TF ChIP-seq: Transcription Factor ChIP-seq (TF ChIP-seq) maps genome-wide transcription factor binding sites.
enum_descriptions.CUT&RUN: Cleavage Under Targets and Release Using Nuclease (CUT&RUN) maps protein-DNA interactions, such as transcription factor binding or histone modifications, by targeting specific proteins with antibodies and releasing nearby DNA fragments using MNase.
enum_descriptions.MPRA: Massively Parallel Reporter Assay (MPRA) evaluates the functional activity of regulatory elements by measuring reporter gene expression.
enum_descriptions.MPRA (scQer): MPRA single-cell Quantitative Expression Reporter (scQer) is a single-cell MPRA variant that uses dual RNA cassettes to separate detection and quantification of reporter gene expression.
enum_descriptions.electroporated MPRA: Electroporated MPRA (Massively Parallel Reporter Assay) is used to evaluate the activity of regulatory elements by introducing them into cells via electroporation.
enum_descriptions.AAV-MPRA: Adeno-Associated Virus Massively Parallel Reporter Assay (AAV-MPRA) is used to evaluate the activity of regulatory elements by introducing them into cells via AAV vectors.
enum_descriptions.lentiMPRA: Lentiviral Massively Parallel Reporter Assay (lentiMPRA) is used to evaluate the activity of regulatory elements by introducing them into cells via lentiviral vectors.
enum_descriptions.STARR-seq: STARR-seq (Self-Transcribing Active Regulatory Region sequencing) is used to identify and quantify enhancer activity by enabling direct transcription of candidate regulatory regions into reporter RNA.
enum_descriptions.Cell painting: A morphological profiling assay that multiplexes fluorescent dyes to reveal relevant cellular components or organelles.
enum_descriptions.Variant painting via fluorescence: A modification of Cell Painting that employs fluorescent protein fusions to protein coding variants to characterize localization alongside cellular morphology.
enum_descriptions.Variant painting via immunostaining: A modification of Cell Painting that employs epitope tagging and immunostaining of protein coding variants to characterize localization alongside cellular morphology.
enum_descriptions.Arrayed Y2H v1: Arrayed Yeast two-hybrid (Y2H) v1 is a yeast-based protein-protein interaction assay that fuses proteins to DNA-binding and Activation domains and measures His3 reporter expression to detect an interaction between pairs of proteins tested individually using a low level of expression of a N-terminal AD fusion.
enum_descriptions.Arrayed Y2H v2: Arrayed Yeast two-hybrid (Y2H) v2 is a yeast-based protein-protein interaction assay that fuses proteins to DNA-binding and Activation domains and measures His3 reporter expression to detect an interaction between pairs of proteins tested individually using a high level of expression of a N-terminal AD fusion.
enum_descriptions.Arrayed Y2H v3: Arrayed Yeast two-hybrid (Y2H) v3 is a yeast-based protein-protein interaction assay that fuses proteins to DNA-binding and Activation domains and measures His3 reporter expression to detect an interaction between pairs of proteins tested individually using a high level of expression of a C-terminal AD fusion.
enum_descriptions.Pooled Y2H v1: Pooled Yeast two-hybrid (Y2H) v1 is a yeast-based protein-protein interaction assay that fuses proteins to DNA-binding and Activation domains and measures His3 reporter expression to detect an interaction between pairs of proteins tested as a pool using a low level of expression of a N-terminal AD fusion.
enum_descriptions.Pooled Y2H v2: Pooled Yeast two-hybrid (Y2H) v2 is a yeast-based protein-protein interaction assay that fuses proteins to DNA-binding and Activation domains and measures His3 reporter expression to detect an interaction between pairs of proteins tested as a pool using a high level of expression of a N-terminal AD fusion.
enum_descriptions.Pooled Y2H v3: Pooled Yeast two-hybrid (Y2H) v3 is a yeast-based protein-protein interaction assay that fuses proteins to DNA-binding and Activation domains and measures His3 reporter expression to detect an interaction between pairs of proteins tested as a pool using a high level of expression of a C-terminal AD fusion.
enum_descriptions.Arrayed semi-qY2H v1: Arrayed Semi-q Yeast two-hybrid (Y2H) v1 is a yeast-based protein-protein interaction assay that fuses proteins to DNA-binding and Activation domains and measures His3 and Ade2 reporter expression in the presences of increasing competitive inhibitors to detect an interaction between pairs of proteins tested individually using a low level of expression of a N-terminal AD fusion.
enum_descriptions.Arrayed semi-qY2H v2: Arrayed Semi-q Yeast two-hybrid (Y2H) v2 is a yeast-based protein-protein interaction assay that fuses proteins to DNA-binding and Activation domains a and measures His3 and Ade2 reporter expression in the presences of increasing competitive inhibitors to detect an interaction between pairs of proteins tested individually using a high level of expression of a N-terminal AD fusion.
enum_descriptions.Arrayed semi-qY2H v3: Arrayed Semi-q Yeast two-hybrid (Y2H) v3 is a yeast-based protein-protein interaction assay that fuses proteins to DNA-binding and Activation domains and measures His3 and Ade2 reporter expression in the presences of increasing competitive inhibitors to detect an interaction between pairs of proteins tested individually using a high level of expression of a C-terminal AD fusion.
enum_descriptions.Arrayed yN2H: Yeast NanoLuc two-hybrid is a yeast-based protein-protein interaction assay that uses reconstitution of split Nano-Luciferase to detect an interaction between pairs of proteins tested individually.
enum_descriptions.Arrayed mN2H: Mammalian NanoLuc two-hybrid is a mammalian-based protein-protein interaction assay that uses reconstitution of split Nano-Luciferase to detect an interaction between pairs of proteins tested individually.
enum_descriptions.smFISH: Single-molecule fluorescence in situ hybridization (smFISH) is used to study gene expression in individual cells by detecting and counting RNA molecules.
enum_descriptions.MERFISH: Multiplexed error-robust fluorescence in situ hybridization (MERFISH) is used to simultaneously image and analyze thousands of RNA species in individual cells.
enum_descriptions.Proliferation CRISPR screen: A CRISPR-based screen that measures cell survival or proliferation as the primary readout.
enum_descriptions.Migration CRISPR screen: A CRISPR-based screen used to identify genes and regulatory elements that influence cell motility.
enum_descriptions.CRISPR FlowFISH screen: A CRISPR-based screen that uses Flow Cytometry and Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization (FlowFISH) to measure the impact of genetic perturbations on RNA expression levels.
enum_descriptions.CRISPR FACS screen: A CRISPR-based screen that employs Fluorescence-Activated Cell Sorting (FACS) to separate and analyze cell populations based on fluorescence markers.
enum_descriptions.CRISPR MACS screen: A CRISPR-based screen that employs Magnetic-Activated Cell Sorting CRISPR screen (MACS) which uses magnetic beads conjugated to specific antibodies or markers to isolate and analyze cells based on surface protein expression.
enum_descriptions.CRISPR mCherry screen: A CRISPR-based screen that uses mCherry fluorescent protein as a reporter to assess gene knockout, activation, or repression effects on cellular processes.
enum_descriptions.HCR-FlowFISH screen: A variation of CRISPR FlowFISH that integrates Hybridization Chain Reaction (HCR) for signal amplification, enabling more sensitive and multiplexed detection of RNA expression changes in CRISPR screens analyzed by flow cytometry.
enum_descriptions.scCRISPR screen: A CRISPR-based screen that combines CRISPR perturbations with single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) to analyze gene expression changes and cellular phenotypes at the single-cell level.
enum_descriptions.Perturb-seq: A single-cell CRISPR screen that combines CRISPR-based gene perturbation with single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq).
enum_descriptions.Parse Perturb-seq: A type of Perturb-seq that uses a plate-based split-pool combinatorial barcoding method to label the cellular origin of transcripts and guides at single cell resolution in a cost-effective way.
enum_descriptions.TAP-seq: A high-throughput, cost-efficient variant of Perturb-seq that focuses single-cell RNA-seq coverage on specific genes of interest.
enum_descriptions.Variant-EFFECTS: A CRISPR-based screen that combines CRISPR prime editing, RNA fluorescence in situ hybridization (FlowFISH), and cell sorting to quantitatively measure the effects of designed DNA sequence variants on gene expression.
enum_descriptions.SGE: A CRISPR-based assay that systematically introduces and evaluates the functional impact of hundreds to thousands of nucleotide substitutions, insertions, or deletions at a specific genomic locus.
enum_descriptions.MIAA: Multiplexed Integrated Accessibility Assay (MIAA) measures how synthetic DNA sequences affect chromatin accessibility in a controlled genomic context.
enum_descriptions.snmC-Seq2: A single-cell DNA methylome sequencing assay with enhances for read mapping, library complexity, and coverage uniformity compared to its predecessor, snmC-seq.
enum_descriptions.snMCT-seq: Single-nucleus methylcytosine and transcriptome sequencing (snmCT-seq), a multi-omic method that requires no physical separation of DNA and RNA molecules.
enum_descriptions.snM3C-seq: Single-nucleus methyl-3C sequencing (snM3C-seq) captures chromatin organization and DNA methylation information and robustly separates heterogeneous cell types.
enum_descriptions.VAMP-seq: Variant Abundance by Massively Parallel Sequencing (VAMP-seq) uses massively parallel sequencing to measure the effects of thousands of missense variants on intracellular protein abundance.
enum_descriptions.VAMP-seq (MultiSTEP): Variant of VAMP-seq that measures the effects of missense variants on secretion and post-translational modification of secreted proteins using a cell surface display method.
enum_descriptions.Hi-C: High-throughput Chromosome Conformation Capture (Hi-C) is used to study the three-dimensional structure of genomes by capturing and analyzing interactions between different regions of DNA.
enum_descriptions.HiCAR: Hi-C on Accessible Regulatory DNA (HiCAR) integrates Tn5 transposase and chromatin proximity ligation to map long-range interactions of open chromatin regions.
enum_descriptions.Spatial transcriptomics: A molecular profiling technique that maps gene expression patterns within intact tissue sections.
enum_descriptions.HT-recruit: A high-throughput (HT) pooled assay that systematically recruits protein libraries to a reporter gene and measures their transcriptional activation or repression effects using sequencing.
enum_descriptions.ONT dRNA: An assay measuring gene expression by directly sequencing RNA instead of converting RNA to cDNA. This assay specifically utilizes Oxford Nanopore sequencing platforms.
enum_descriptions.ONT Fiber-seq: A DNA methylation profiling assay in which chromatin stencils are created by treating nuclei with m6A methyltransferase (MTase) and then sequenced using single-molecule circular consensus sequencing to identify regions of accessible DNA at nucleotide resolution.
enum_descriptions.ONT direct WGS: An assay to determine the entire sequence of an organism's genome. This assay specifically utilizes Oxford Nanopore sequencing platforms.
enum_descriptions.Bisulfite-seq: Bisulfite sequencing (Bisulfite-seq) is used to detect DNA methylation by treating DNA with sodium bisulfite, which converts unmethylated cytosines to uracil, allowing the identification of methylated cytosines at single-base resolution through sequencing.
enum_descriptions.WGS: Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS) is an assay to determine the entire sequence of an organism's genome.

items.title: Source
items.comment: See source.json or lab.json for available identifiers.

lot_id.title: Lot ID
lot_id.description: The lot identifier provided by the originating lab or vendor.

product_id.title: Product ID
product_id.description: The product identifier provided by the originating lab or vendor.

publications.title: Publications
publications.description: The publications associated with this object.

items.title: Publication
items.description: A publication associated with this object.

reference_files.title: Reference Files
reference_files.description: Link to the reference files used to generate this file.

items.title: Reference File
items.description: Link to a reference file used to generate this file.

transcriptome_annotation.title: Transcriptome Annotation
transcriptome_annotation.description: The annotation and version of the reference resource.
transcriptome_annotation.comment: This enum list should be updated simultaneously for matrix file.

assembly.title: Genome Assembly
assembly.comment: This enum list should be updated simultaneously for matrix file.

release_timestamp.title: Release Timestamp
release_timestamp.description: The date the object was released.
release_timestamp.comment: Do not submit. The date the object is released is assigned by the server.

preview_timestamp.title: Preview Timestamp
preview_timestamp.description: The date the object was previewed.
preview_timestamp.comment: Do not submit. The date the object is previewed is assigned by the server.

small_scale_gene_list.title: Small Scale Gene List
small_scale_gene_list.description: A small scale list (<=100) of gene(s).

items.title: Gene
items.comment: See gene.json for a list of available identifiers.

large_scale_gene_list.title: Large Scale Gene List
large_scale_gene_list.description: A large scale list (>100) of genes.

filtered.title: Filtered
filtered.description: Indicates whether the file has gone through some filtering step, for example, removal of PCR duplicates or filtering based on significance calling.

small_scale_loci_list.title: Small Scale Loci List
small_scale_loci_list.description: A small scale (<=100) list of specific chromosomal region(s).
small_scale_loci_list.comment: Each locus is defined using 1-based, fully-closed (inclusive) coordinates for a specific version of the reference genome assembly.

assembly.title: Mapping assembly
assembly.description: The genome assembly to which coordinates relate (e.g., GRCh38).

chromosome.title: Chromosome
chromosome.description: The number (or letter) designation for the chromosome, e.g. chr1 or chrX

large_scale_loci_list.title: Large Scale Loci List
large_scale_loci_list.description: A large scale list (>100) of specific chromosomal regions.

input_file_sets.title: Input File Sets
input_file_sets.description: The file set(s) that served as inputs for this file set.

items.title: Input File Set
items.description: A file set that serves as input for this file set.

cell_type_annotation.title: Cell Type Annotation
cell_type_annotation.description: The inferred cell type this file is associated with based on single-cell expression profiling.

source_url.title: Source URL
source_url.description: A link to an external resource hosting data associated with the object.

externally_hosted.title: Externally Hosted
externally_hosted.description: Indicates whether the file is externally hosted and not stored on portal.

external_host_url.title: External Host URL
external_host_url.description: A link to the resource where the file is externally hosted.

control_file_sets.title: Controls
control_file_sets.description: File sets that can serve as scientific controls for this file set.

items.title: Control
items.description: File sets that can serve as scientific controls for this file set.
items.comment: See fileset.json for a list of available identifiers.

base_modifications.title: Base Modifications
base_modifications.description: The chemical modifications to bases in a DNA sequence that are detected in this file.

items.title: Base Modification
items.description: The chemical modification to bases in a DNA sequence that is detected in this file.
